reviews.review_msg:
-took both CHIN 100 & 110 (101) w/Prof. Ng
-inconsistent and harsh marking
-time for oral exams was ALWAYS shorter than promised
-online platform not great
-in person tutorials very content heavy(necessary to go to)
-occasionally would be tested on words we did not know/cover
-good at responding to emails
-multiple places for assignments(confusing)

I'm in my 3rd  Chinese course with Billie (Wu laoshi) and my experience has been positive overall. Although the course isn't perfect, she genuinely cares about student experience. There's am emphasis on showing what you know, so she gives part marks.
The content in 101 is much more challenging than 100, but not unfairly so. I recommend.

a lot of work for the type of course. The one person who is doing the best and is answering most questions is also Chinese... Says that it isn't based on tests but my mark was bad cuz of them. First class said she won't be picky with details on exam and gave me a bad grade because of "the details." I want to learn chinese but this ain't it.

Do not take this course with Billie after CHIN 100 if you are looking for an easy mark. Impossible to get high marks compared to CHIN 100 unless you are a Chinese. Only Chinese people who were born here but pretend to not know any Chinese get A's. Will not take any other CHIN courses at SFU because of how poorly Billie managed with the course

She is just a professor with horrible teaching ability. Would speak so fast that anyone who is not Chinese cannot understand what she is saying, but only the ethnic Chinese people can understand her and accomplish her tasks with high marks. She would check her background which is meaningless af because ethnic Chinese can obviously understand her
The class was more intense than CHIN100 but you learn a lot. Not too difficult if you did well in CHIN100. Be careful though, she tries to find ways to take as much marks off as possible.

Seems like she doesn't care about teaching anymore. Her textbook is not that great and kind of useless. She's nice but she doesn't seem to care if we know the pronunciation or not, which is the most important part of the Chinese language. I liked Jia Fei much better.

She is a good teacher. Very helpful, in class quizes are easy if you study for it. The Chinese book didn't have a lot of chapters which is good. She does pick on students for answers in class, but she isn't mean if you don't know the answer. It is fun, class is always interesting. Presentations are present fotr this class.

This is a great course and she is a great prof. No, she did not give easy marks.  To those who are taking this course to learn, we had to work very hard.  You will learn a lot.  Those who are taking this course for easy credit should not be in this course in the first place.

I took this course simply it is too asy. She gave higher marks to please students. Her pronunciation seems not standard Chinese, cus it is different from what i heard from tapes. how can she teach at the university level???
Best teacher I ever had!!! You can see that she totally enjoys teaching and that's the type of teacher that we need. She makes learning FUN!
Great class, interesting material, and very nice prof. Try to be keen though cuz she knows who is late and talking in the back of the class.
Very nice teacher. But try not to goof around cuz she notices...
very nice and cheerful.  makes the class enjoyable
